channel.title: My Linux Ubuntu can't run any client whatsoever?
channel.description: I installed Java and everything. I try to run the run file for any server's client and nothing happens at all. Can anyone help me?

item.title: My Linux Ubuntu can't run any client whatsoever?
item.dc:creator: @Fat_Cookies Fat Cookies
item.description:
@Fat_Cookies wrote:

Are you sure you are running shell files and not batch files.
The basic syntax for shell (.sh) files to run a java application is:

#!/bin/sh
java -Xmx500m -cp YourMainClass

It is very similar to batch files. “YourMainClass” is usaully “client” or “EGUI” but some clients are different.

Read full topic
item.source: My Linux Ubuntu can't run any client whatsoever?
